class pelpi.Model.LaserPlasmaInteraction.Bell1997(LaserPlasmaInteraction)[source]¶

Class for estimating … Return current

Variables:
  • float (z0,) – Estimate of the number of accelerated electrons.
  • float – Estimate of the penetration depth of fast electrons (distance from the surface).
checkHypotheses()[source]¶
electron_hot_numberTotal()¶
electron_hot_lengthCaracDepth()[source]¶
Hypotheses()¶
---------
Short pulse (< 1 ps)
High intensity (>10^18 W.cm^-2)
Colisionless plasma
Maxwellian hot electron distribution
Constant conductivity in the plasma
T0 constant during the laser pulse (collision time larger than interaction time)
Reference()¶
--------
A R Bell, J R Davies, S Guerin, H Ruhl,
Fast-electron transport in high-intensity short-pulse laser-solid experiments,
Plasma Phys. Control. Fusion, 1997.

Notes

checkHypotheses()[source]

Check the hypotheses of the model.

Warnings can be configured in pelpi.warnings.filterwarnings method.

class pelpi.Model.LaserPlasmaInteraction.Common(LaserPlasmaInteraction)[source]¶

Class containing obvious theoretical estimations, for order of magnitudes. It also contains commonly used functions, such as Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution, Spitzer conductivity, etc … that would not be relevant to include in a dedicated object due to their old and massive use.

Notes

checkHypotheses()[source]¶

Because this class is used for various features, the checkHypotheses method do nothing here. Hypotheses are checked in methods.

electron_distribution(distribution, kinetic_energy, temperature)[source]¶
electron_hot_numberTotal(temperature_hot, absorption_efficiency)[source]¶

Return an estimate of the hot electron total number, based on the assumption that hot electron distribution is a Maxwellian.

Parameters:
  • float (absorption_efficiency,) – Hot electron temperature
  • float – Laser absorption efficiency into hot electrons
  • math (.) – n_0 = frac{eta_{l} E_{l}}{3/2 T_e^{hot}} with $n_0$ the hot electron total number, $eta_l$ the laser absorption efficiency into hot electrons, $E_l$ the laser total energy, $T_e^{hot}$ the thermal energy of hot electrons.
laser_efficiencyAbsorption()[source]¶
target_conductivity(temperature_cold, log_coulomb)[source]¶

Spitzer conductivity.

class pelpi.Model.LaserPlasmaInteraction.Davies2003(LaserPlasmaInteraction)[source]¶

Theoretical paper on Electric and Magnetic field generation and target heating by laser-generated fast electrons + electrical conductivity. Change of resistivity due to Ohmic heating.

Material is a conductor Arbitrary power law of resistivity on temperature Electron current is fixed (rigid beam approximation) Charge diffusion is instantaneous Magnetic diffusion is negligible

class pelpi.Model.LaserPlasmaInteraction.Mora2003(LaserPlasmaInteraction)[source]¶

Theoretical paper on plasma expansion into vacuum, focused on ion acceleration and calculations of electric fields.

1d, Maxwellian electron distribution (constant in time), sharp edge …
